page.title: 01Strath Beag/Beinn Dearg Mhor
page.content: The block is totally uninhabited, and contains no evidence of man other than a part of the A881 that shirts around Loch Slapin towards Elgol. The area is a mixture of Loch River and Bog with the harsh granite scenery of Beinn Deag Mhor rising in the east. The land has two main uses, firstly for sheep grazing and secondly as an amenity for all sorts of people from town, city and local who want to see the sparse remains of an unspoilt landscape. At a time when mans mark has been left scaring most of our once beautiful landscape a reminder such as this is wonderful.
